course_title: Special Topics in African American Studies: Rise of Black Women Hollywood
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 3 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as FILM 285 2, WGS 285 )
This course will examine the rise of Black women in Hollywood in front of and behind the camera, particularly in television and film. The theoretical framework for the course will be a blend of Black Womanist Theory and Cultural theory as we examine the topic through a historical lens with a focus on contemporary stars, filmmakers, creative executives and their relationship to media industries and society. The course will consist of lecture, scholarly and trade readings, screenings and discussion.
MCP Elective
course_description: Wide range of topics pertinent to the African American experience.

M 4pm-6pm in White Hall 208
